content: रसः [रस्-अच्] {@--1@} Sap, juice (of trees); इक्षुरसः, कुसुमरसः &c. {@--2@} A liquid, fluid; <ls>Ku. 1. 7.</ls> {@--3@} Water; सहस्रगुणमुत्स्रष्टुमादत्ते हिरसं रविः <ls>R. 1. 18</ls>; <ls>Bv. 2. 144.</ls> {@--4@} Liquor, drink; <ls>Ms. 2. 177.</ls> {@--5@} A draught, potion. {@--6@} Taste, flavour, relish (<ab>fig.</ab> also) (considered in <ls>Vaiś.</ls> <ab>phil.</ab> as one of the 24 guṇas; the {%rasas%} are six; कटु, अम्ल, मधुर, लवण, तिक्त and कवाय); परायत्तः प्रीतेः कथमिव रसं वेत्तुपुरुषः <ls>Mu. 3. 4</ls>; <ls>U. 2. 2.</ls> {@--7@} A sauce, condiment. {@--8@} An object of taste; <ls>R. 3. 4.</ls> {@--9@} Taste or inclination for a thing, liking, desire; इष्टे वस्तुन्युपचितरसाः प्रेमराशीभवंति <ls>Me. 112.</ls> {@--10@} Love, affection; जरसा यस्मिन्नहार्यो रसः <ls>U. 1. 39</ls>; प्रसरति रसो निर्वृतिघनः <ls n="U.">6. 11</ls> ‘a feeling of love’; रमादृते <ls>V. 2. 21</ls>; <ls>Ku. 3. 37.</ls> {@--11@} Pleasure, delight, happiness; <ls>R. 3. 26.</ls> {@--12@} Charm, interest, elegance, beauty. {@--13@} Pathos, emotion, feeling. {@--14@} (In poetic compositions) A sentiment; नवरसरुचिरां निर्मितिमादधती भारती कवेर्जयति <ls>K. P. 1.</ls> (The {%rasas%} are usually eight: --शृंगारहास्यकरुणरौद्रवीरभयानकाः . बीभत्साद्भुतसंज्ञौ चेत्यष्टौ नाट्यं रसाः स्मृताः, but sometimes शांतरस is added thus making the total number 9; निर्वेदस्थायिभावोस्ति शांतोपि नवमो रसः <ls>K. P. 4</ls>; sometimes a tenth, वात्सल्यरस, is also added. {%Rasas%} are more or less a necessary factor of every poetic composition, but, according to Viśvanātha, they constitute the very essence of poetry; वाक्यं रसात्मकं काव्यं <ls>S. D. 3.</ls>). {@--15@} Essence, pith, best part. {@--16@} A constituent fluid of the body. {@--17@} Semen virile. {@--18@} Mercury. {@--19@} A poison, poisonous drink; as in तीक्ष्णरसदायिनः {@--20@} Any mineral metallic salt. {@--21@} Juice of the sugar-cane. {@--22@} Milk. {@--23@} Melted butter. {@--24@} Nectar. {@--25@} Soup, broth. {@--26@} A symbolical expression for the number ‘six’. {@--27@} The tongue. {@--28@} Myrrh. {@--29@} Gold. {@--30@} A metal in a state of fusion
